definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: He stressed he had the power of life and death over the hostages in the building.
sentences.chinese: 他強調他對大樓內的人質有生殺大權。

sentences.english: They hold the power of life and death over millions.
sentences.chinese: 他們掌握着數百萬人的生殺大權。

sentences.english: The skill of the disease could save lives, book in hand.
sentences.chinese: 得這種病的人能否保住性命，生殺大權在閻王爺手中。
